extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 4901, SCHOLARSHIPS FOR OPPORTUNITY AND RESULTS REAUTHORIZATION ACT; PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.J.; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 66

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to the definition of the term ``Fiduciary''
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.J. Res. 88, disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to the definition of the term ``Fiduciary'', by a yea-and-nay vote of 234 yeas to 183 nays, Roll No. 176.<P/>H. Res. 706, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4901) and the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 88) was agreed to by a yea-and-nay vote of 234 yeas to 183 nays, Roll No. 174, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 231 yeas to 182 nays, Roll No. 173.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to the definition of the term ``Fiduciary''
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.J. Res. 88, disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to the definition of the term ``Fiduciary'', by a yea-and-nay vote of 234 yeas to 183 nays, Roll No. 176.<P/>H. Res. 706, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4901) and the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 88) was agreed to by a yea-and-nay vote of 234 yeas to 183 nays, Roll No. 174, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 231 yeas to 182 nays, Roll No. 173.

FLOOD INSURANCE MARKET PARITY AND MODERNIZATION ACT

extension.searchTitle: FLOOD INSURANCE MARKET PARITY AND MODERNIZATION ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 66

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Flood Insurance Market Parity and Modernization Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures which were debated on Tuesday, April 26th:<P/>H.R. 2901, amended, to amend the Flood Disaster Protection Act of 1973 to require that certain buildings and personal property be covered by flood insurance, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 419 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 177.
